warnings.issue: Progress indicator dots lack screen reader announcements
warnings.description: Step progress dots at lines 1296-1304 are purely visual (colored divs) with no aria-label or sr-only text to announce current step position (e.g., 'Step 3 of 12'). The text at line 1307 partially mitigates (displays '3 / 12') but is not associated with aria-live for dynamic updates.

warnings.issue: Property type selection cards lack proper radio/group semantics
warnings.description: Property type options (APARTMENT, VILLA, etc.) at the property_type step render as styled buttons but lack role='radiogroup'/role='radio' or equivalent ARIA markup. Screen readers would not announce them as selectable options with a currently-selected state.

ConfirmModal.tsx uses <Dialog>/<DialogContent>/<DialogHeader>/<DialogTitle>/<DialogDescription> from @/components/ui/dialog (Radix-based). Radix Dialog automatically provides role='dialog', aria-modal, focus trap, ESC key, and focus restoration.
AlertModal.tsx uses same Radix Dialog pattern. Includes DialogTitle and DialogDescription for proper ARIA labeling.
UnionHomeHeader.tsx line 138: aria-label='메뉴 열기', aria-expanded={isSidebarOpen}, aria-controls='mobile-sidebar'

Desktop user menu button (L272-275): aria-label='사용자 메뉴 열기', aria-expanded={isUserMenuOpen}, aria-haspopup='menu'. Dropdown (L290-294): role='menu', aria-label='사용자 메뉴'. Menu items have role='menuitem'.

UnionMobileSidebar.tsx uses <Sheet>/<SheetContent> (Radix-based) with SheetTitle/SheetDescription (sr-only for screen readers). Nav area has aria-label='메인 네비게이션'. Menu buttons have aria-expanded and focus-visible ring styles.
Both mobile (L149) and desktop (L179) logo links have aria-label='{union.name} 홈으로 이동'

warnings.issue: NoticePopup lacks role and ARIA for overlay widget
warnings.description: NoticePopup is a fixed-position overlay but lacks role='dialog' or role='complementary' and aria-label. Not critical since it's not a modal (no backdrop, no focus trap), but could benefit from landmark markup.

findings.evidence: #4E8C6D on white background has contrast ratio of ~4.6:1, meeting WCAG AA for normal text (4.5:1 minimum)

text-gray-500 (~#6B7280) on white has ~5.0:1 ratio (PASS). text-gray-400 (~#9CA3AF) on white has ~2.9:1 ratio which fails AA for normal text but passes for large text. Used in several sub-descriptions and labels.

warnings.issue: text-gray-400 may fail contrast for small text
warnings.description: text-gray-400 (#9CA3AF) on white bg has approximately 2.9:1 contrast ratio, below the 4.5:1 AA requirement for normal text. Used in sub-descriptions (RegisterModal stepConfig.subDescription, MemberEditModal field labels like '토지면적'), and icon placeholders.

strengths: All 6 custom modals (RegisterModal, ApprovalPendingModal, ApprovalRejectedModal, BlockedUserModal, MemberEditModal, BlockMemberModal) implement proper ARIA dialog pattern (role='dialog'/'alertdialog', aria-modal='true', aria-labelledby)
Centralized useFocusTrap hook correctly handles Tab/Shift+Tab trapping, initial focus, and focus restoration
ESC key handler implemented in all closable modals
ConfirmModal and AlertModal leverage Radix Dialog for automatic ARIA compliance
Skip navigation link ('본문 바로가기') present in all layout variants with proper sr-only/focus:not-sr-only pattern
Header navigation has comprehensive ARIA: aria-label, aria-expanded, aria-haspopup, role='menu'/role='menuitem'
Error messages consistently use role='alert' for screen reader announcement
All images have descriptive alt text
Focus-visible ring styles applied to interactive elements in header/sidebar
ApprovalRejectedModal edit form uses htmlFor/id associations and aria-required on inputs
